title: Amid controversy over Amit Shah’s Hindi remark, A R Rahman shares post on ‘Goddess Tamil’ - The Indian Express
content:
1. Amid controversy over Amit Shah’s Hindi remark, A R Rahman shares post on ‘Goddess Tamil’  The Indian Express
  2. Amit Shah's Renewed Hindi Push: Opposition Slams Home Minister's 'Imposition' Of 'Language Of India'  TIMES NOW
  3. Amit Shah’s push for Hindi draws ire of Congress and JD(S)  Times of India
  4. BJP unleashing ‘cultural terrorism’ against non-Hindi speaking States: Congress  The Hindu
  5. After Amit Shah’s remark on use of Hindi, AAP leader raises concern over impact on Goa tourism  ThePrint
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: A R Rahman shared an illustration of “Thamizhanangu” of “Goddess Tamil”, a word from Tamil Thai Vaazhthu or the Tamil national anthem, penned by Manonmaniam Sundaram Pillai and composed by M S Viswanathan.
